extendedInfo.description: Measure the pulse and respiration rate of yourself and others using your camera.To use: - Steady the camera by resting it on a table (for example). - Position your face in the top box and shoulders in the bottom box. - Push 'Start' and keep still while the measurement is in progress. - Your pulse and respiration rate will be displayed. - Select "Switch camera" from the menu to change the camera (on supported phone).How it works: - Movement of your chest is used to measure respiration rate. - Small changes in reflectivity from your face are used to measure pulse.  Each heart beat our faces pulsate - changing in reflectivity by about 1%, if these changes were 2% then we would be able to see them with our eyes, at 1% they are just detectable with a smartphone camera (after a few seconds of measurement).Disclaimer: This remote sensing software is fallible and so it is not recommended for important measurements.Requires a phone with a front-facing camera and Android 2.3 or higher.

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: Incredible App.  Had My Pulse manually Checked At The Same Time And The Readings From This App Are Spot On!  Top Marks To The Developer.  Would Like To See A log/History Function.
reviews.author: Steve McGrath

reviews.title: Fun and cool new app!!
reviews.comment: Cool!! I had to set it down or hold it extremely steady though but still really cool!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very cool
reviews.comment: Verified pulse with another app and counted breaths.
reviews.author: A Google User
